page.title: 20 Ghosts and Ghouls Oxford
page.content: The Weeping Child of Wolvercote This story which dates back to 1744 is still told about a vicar of Wolvercote. Returning late one night from Oxford,his lantern went out. Continuing on his way in the dark he suddenly heard a strange sound of a child weeping. Suddenly for no apparent reason his lantern shone again lighting up another such lamp on the ground. Fetching a spade the vicar began to dig and came across the skeleton of a longÂ£dead child.This was later removed and given a Christian burial in the churchÂ£yard in Wolvercote. The story goes that the child was shot by the Kings guards at the defences of Oxford a hundred years previously.
